timeline.bodyText: Can we avoid duplication and use the same String constant for both OM and SCM servlet endpoints?

timeline.bodyText: Most of the code between the OM and SCM servlet is common. We should be able to abstract out common logic between the two and have just one copy. How about a super DBCheckpointServlet class from which both the servlets inherit logic?

Why do we need to increase timeout here?
Instead, since only 1 of the 2 tests need the MiniOzoneCluster, we can change the cluster init to @BeforeClass or pull it into the test method. We can also add .setNumDatanodes(1) since we do not need 3 DNs. On my local host, I can see a significant perf improvement.
(Similarly for the corresponding test)

timeline.bodyText:
Passing half initialized this to another constructor can cause tricky timing related bugs that are hard to debug at runtime. For example, the metrics are registered on line 368 after line 335.
Based on the servlet code, we can minimize the dependency with just MetaStore and the DBCheckPointMetrics here, and set/get them into/from the webAppContext.
initialize(scm.getScmMetadataStore().getStore(),
    scm.getMetrics().getDBCheckpointMetrics());
timeline.author: xiaoyuyao

replies.bodyText:
Hi Xiaoyu, thanks for the comment. I get the point that we should avoid passing half inited objects to other constructors. But I didn't quite get this:

Based on the servlet code, we can minimize the dependency with just MetaStore and the DBCheckPointMetrics here, and set/get them into/from the webAppContext.

Could you elaborate a bit on this? Thanks!
replies.author: smengcl

replies.bodyText:
@xiaoyuyao I decided to move httpServer = new StorageContainerManagerHttpServer(conf, this); from SCM constructor to start() -- the same approach as we already do for OM:

  
    
      ozone/hadoop-ozone/ozone-manager/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/ozone/om/OzoneManager.java
    
    
         Line 1187
      in
      d964cc9
    
    
    
    

        
          
           httpServer = new OzoneManagerHttpServer(configuration, this); 
        
    
  


This should avoid the race condition. Pls take a look when you are available. :)
I have tested locally that http://127.0.0.1:9876/dbCheckpoint downloads the SCM DB archive for me.
